There is a bug somewhere regarding cubes like those, but if you rotate it with either Q/E, W/S, or A/D it will work properly at some point.

There is a bug somewhere regarding cubes like those.

It's a general problem with the node system in that it'll only do the first attachment of a part on two nodes even if it has more.

Rotating them to the node that's at the top and bottom by default is the one you're trying to connect will work.

I would say they aren't, it's the first physics steps that checks for docking port distance and glues them up.

For example while working on this:

I noticed that sometimes docking ports wouldn't connect properly even if they were lined up nicely (even with symmetry and EdTools to provide vertical snap) - it was probably due to engine induced wobble on ground when i had mainsails connected to orange tanks, and having slow pc didn't help either.

Btw that ship works with no struts and decouplers, perfectly flyable by hand. Lifts ~250t to LKO

Also if you undock a part of a space station and exit to space center before it drifts away it will dock immediately after returning to simulation (useful for realignment or closing docking loops in space).
